msbt.message: <20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />? Hmmm<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Whatever Reckon we just have a new landmark for when we're givin' directions anywhere on the island!

<20_3 arg="10" />Just thinkin' about sleepin' on the ground makes my back ache<20_2 arg="9" />So I reckon I'm glad someone left out .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />You know, just in case I feel an outdoor nap comin' on
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_3 arg="9" />Huh, outdoor television <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />What'll they think of next, ?
<20_2 arg="10" />Why would someone leave out <20_2 arg="9" />?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Maybe we could throw an outdoor listenin' party
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Whose is this?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Better leave it be an' see if anyone claims it. Guess only time will tell! Get it? Gahaha!

They say talkin' at plants helps 'em grow, but does that work outdoors?<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Um Heya! How's your day goin'?<10_4 /> <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Hrm, I dunno Think that helped?<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Seem any healthier to you?
<20_3 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Not so sure about open-air bathin'<10_4 /> <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />No one wants to see my wrinkly ol' carcass gettin' out of a tub!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Seems like an odd place for sippin' coffee and eatin' donuts.<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />But donut worry, I reckon I could make it work for me! Gahaha!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Nice of someone to give me a place to sit and take a li'l breather out in the middle of nature<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Does my heart good, seein' someone bein' considerate!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Ain't the best at playin' them things, <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />but I'm OK with a pair of maracas.
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Someone's been cookin' alfresco! <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />There's somethin' special about a meal grilled up outdoors
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />!I could honestly use more exercise<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Not sure I'd wanna work out in the open, though I guess most of my exercise is from walkin' around.
<20_2 arg="10" />Do you get a campin' vibe from<20_2 arg="9" /> ?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Makes me wanna roast marshmallows and start some sing-alongs

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Hey, wouldja look at that? There's
out here, .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Yeah, I used to flap my gums about all the light pollutionBut YOU try steppin' on a slimy leaf in the dead of night and see if you don't change your tune!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />You think it's silly to put outside like this?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Think again! Imagine walkin' around with scraggly eyebrows without realizin' it.That's my life, kiddo. Only now I can fix 'em when I walk past this thing. Gahaha!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Whoa, whoa, whoa You think
grew here naturally?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Nah, this is furniture pollution, kiddo. It ain't right!Ah, who am I kiddin'? As soon as I finish my art installation, it's goin' on display!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Whose idea was it to stick here?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I can't say I'm too big a fan of bugs, but even I gotta admit the little fella is pretty cute, !

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />My! I get so nostalgic whenever I see .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />The face reminds me of an old pal of mine. He'd spend so much time swimmin', we joked he was part fish!Actually, we ain't talked in quite a few years. Wonder what he's been up to, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Y'know, if fossils could talk, I bet we'd all get a whole earful outta that .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Sure, it'd be a bunch of bewildered hooey about electricity and phones, but there'd be a lot of it! Gahaha!

<20_2 arg="10" />I won't claim I know much about art, <20_2 arg="9" />but I do know I like having here.<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Just slips me into a sophisticated mindset, like I'm about to sip the finest vintage . Mmm!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I once knew an artist who had a talent for sculptin' stuff like here.She'd always say something about trying to bring out the true self of the stone or whatever, .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I tell ya, when she set her mind to makin' something, it was a sight! Still impresses me all these years later.

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I ain't no art critic, but I can't help feelin' something's off about there.<20_3 arg="3" />Not that it matters.<20_3 arg="6" /> It's the flaws that make a thing endearing. Goes for art as anythin' else, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />I remember when I was still just a little , and my ma got us .<20_3 arg="3" />Back then, they made quite a racket. But I liked the sound, so I'd turn it on even if it was freezin' inside.<20_3 arg="6" />Drove my ma nuts too, but that was just a bonus, . Gahaha!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />What's the tale behind puttin' there?<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />I'm only asking 'cause I can't seem to stop starin' every time I walk by. Gorgeous little fella, .
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Now that there is one handsome , !<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Warms the heart knowin' someone around here's got taste!
<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />There's no such thing as too old when it comes to playin' with .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Too sore? Maybe. Too stubborn? Sure. Too ? Yep! But never too old, !

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Y'know, I had a friend who used to spend all his time playin' with his .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Honestly, I never could understand the appeal. Always just seemed too complicated for me, .

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />It kinda bothers me, seein' here.I understand that it's none of my business judgin' where folks wanna put their things, .<20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />But that doesn't mean I gotta like havin' to walk around it!

<20_2 arg="10" /><20_2 arg="9" />Who would up and leave here?Oh! Maybe that's meant to be some kinda highfalutin artistic statement about the technology in our lives.Or Maybe someone just forgot to bring their stuff home. <20_3 arg="6" /><20_3 arg="3" />Yeah, I reckon that's probably it, .
